results.title: Jazz scrapbook
results.brief_description:

[The film reflects times past has some scenes that may not sit well with contemporary viewers.]

results.title: Cyclone = Ciclon
results.creator_credit: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC) and Santiago Alvarez
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film showing the havoc caused by the cyclone which hit the western provinces of Cuba in October, 1963. Reveals the tragic consequences for the poor peasants and also shows the care taken of the injured and the homeless.

results.title: All that is solid
results.brief_description: This is a speculative documentary on the subject of the future of Australia. It is conceived as a series of competing discourses with visionaries, politicians, media commentators and others, who are variously optimistic and pessimistic. Interviews are interspersed with symbolic, imaginative drama.

results.title: Women in the surf
results.brief_description: The first non-fiction feature about Australia’s women of the surf tells the history of women’s surfing in Australia from 1915. It moves through the big board era to the present day, with women becoming a surfing entity in their own right. The video shows the women surf riders surfing their own calender and tells of their hopes, fears and pleasures as they ride the waves.

results.title: [Black Knight]
results.brief_description: A survey of the development of the British “Black Knight” rocket test vehicle and its use in high speed flight and ballistic missile research. The elements of construction, ground support equipment, propulsion, guidance and instrumentation are discussed. Tests and launching preparations at Australia’s Woomera Range follow, closing with a night-firing sequence. NB: No opening or closing credits

results.title: The Work prejudice film
results.creator_credit: Allan Frank Sandler, Sandler Institutional Films and Ray Rivas
results.brief_description: Investigates the stereotypes surrounding the world of work relevant to an American situation. Documentation and humour are used to motivate the young person who faces 25 to 45 years in the workforce. Narrated by Robert Vaughn. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Coal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Elementary account of Australia’s coal industry showing models of coal formations; the principal coal mining areas of Australia; views of Wollongong, Newcastle and Lithgow, centres of coal mining areas; open cut mining at Musellbrook; the uses to which coal is put and some of its principal by-products.

results.title: [Cinesound Review: Royal Tour Concludes]
results.creator_credit: Peter Bell, William M. Carty and Cinesound
results.brief_description:
This film is a Cinesound Review, a news broadcast that covered significant social, cultural and political events in Australia. The newsreel shows the final leg of the 1970 Royal Tour with Queen Elizabeth II, Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh and Princess Anne, for the bicentenary celebrations of the arrival of Captain James Cook in Australia in 1770.

The film shows the royal family arriving in Brisbane, Queensland, on the Royal Yacht Britannia, where they are greeted by crowds of people in hundreds of boats on the river. It shows the family attending various events, including a welcome at Parliament House, theatre shows and a children’s parade at Lang Park, or Brisbane Stadium.

Princess Anne visits a sheep station at Cunnamulla, Queensland, while Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip visit the mines at Mount Isa, Queensland.

The film shows bicentenary celebrations in Cooktown, Queensland, and Botany Bay, New South Wales. These celebrations include a speech by the Queen and re-enactments of Captain James Cook’s arrival in Australia in 1770, with interactions with Aboriginal Australian people.

The film continues with fireworks over Sydney Harbour; an ANZAC Day march in Canberra, Australian Capital Territory; Prince Philip playing polo with a local team; and the opening of the international terminal at Sydney Airport, from which the royal family departs.
